amendment.description: Amendment clarifies that cyber security service providers need only provide information about cyber security incidents if they pose a threat to the government's information and protects individuals' private data from being accessed by the government solely because it is stored by a company that provides information services to a government agency.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 12 printed in House Report 113-41 to clarify that cyber security service providers need only provide information about cyber security incidents if they pose a threat to the government's information and protects individuals' private data from being accessed by the government solely because it is stored by a company that provides information services to a government agency.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Jackson Lee amendment (A010) Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Amendment (A010) offered by Ms. Jackson Lee.
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A010) offered by Ms. Jackson Lee.
Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Jackson Lee amendment (A010) Agreed to by voice vote.
